intro: Plesioneuron notabile, commonly known as the notable plesioneuron, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Pteridaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like fronds that exhibit a distinctive pattern of lobes and serrations. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions with high humidity. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing sorus, are positioned on the underside of its leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in many areas.
